_header: Bolning of brooks breaks the brinks
_description: Aphoristic advice on causes and effects and on forethought — four monorhyming and alliterative lines

NottsULMeLm1.Transcription:
Bolnyng of brokes brekes the brynkesSylden wakes he wel that in wo
                    wynkesSel nere thy chaffare there bodone ware stynkesYf thre thryve in
                    a town thrytty forthynkes
NottsULMeLm1.Note: Added to bottom of page by a hand of the fifteenth century.
NottsULMeLm1.Editions:
Davis,  Norman. 
             “Chaucer’s Gentilesse: A Forgotten Manuscript with some
                Proverbs.” 
             Review of English Studies
         20 (1969): 43-50: 48.
